title.narrative: OUTPUT 009: NUTRITION POLICY & DATA

description.narrative: Output 009- Nutrition Policy and Data: Systems in place for development and implementation of evidence-based and equity-focused national nutrition policy and strategic plan, which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Community-Based Management Of Acute Malnutrition, Infant And Young Child Feeding, Maternal And Newborn Health, Micronutrients, Nutrition And Hiv, Nutrition â€“ General, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: OUTCOME 003 - Maternal, Neonatal and Child Nutrition: Maternal and Child under-nutrition rates are reduced through the scale-up of integrated, evidence-based high-impact nutrition interventions with a special focus on the five deprived regions.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 009- Nutrition Policy and Data: Systems in place for development and implementation of evidence-based and equity-focusednational nutrition policy and strategic plan

description.narrative: UNICEF-Ghana continued to engage with development partners on Scaling Up Nutrition in Ghana, linked with the First Lady&39;s initiative on reducing malnutrition and malaria in priority populations, leveraged high level support for launching nutrition programmes and supported the first national micronutrients survey to inform future planning and programmes. | Status:Met | As-of Date:29/12/2017

title.narrative: Number of districts implementing new system for monitoring implementation of key interventions in the nutrition strategic plan

actual.value: 2017:All 216 districts were oriented and are implementing. However there is a need for close supervision and validation of data

title.narrative: Percentage of health facilities that provide treatment services for the management of SAM
Policy and action plan available and being implemented in at least 4 most deprived regions

baseline.value: No policy or action plan available

actual.value: 2017:National Nutrition Policy was finally launched by health Minister in July 2016

title.narrative: National or local Nutrition sector plans integrate risk management strategies addressing risks related to disasters, climate change, conflict, public health emergencies or other crises
Baseline for iron and folic acid supplementation in Northern and Volta Regions established

target.value: 2017:Baseline for Iron and Folic supplementation for Northern and Volta Regions available

actual.value: 2017:A total of 60 schools (30 each in Northern and Volta regions) participated in the baseline data collection. Haemoglobin and malaria tests were conducted, heights and weights taken, and individual questionnaires administered to 1636 respondents.

title.narrative: Micronutrients assessment and reports disseminated

baseline.value: Reports of micronutrients assessments not available

actual.value: 2017:Survey report available. Plans ongoing to disseminate to key players in first quarter of 2018.
